issue.title: Homebrew problem with protobuf and plugins (dlclose)

content.raw:
Here is an update on this issue.

In November, we received [reports that gazebo wasn't working on OS X 10.10](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/issues/32). Part of this involved a compiler error when using protobuf 2.6, so I started testing the unpatched version of protobuf. After fixing the compiler error, I found that I wasn't seeing the protobuf bug that motivated this patch.

After further testing, I was able to reproduce the bug by using incorrect environment variables. This inspired me to try to fix the environment variables in our homebrew jenkins script (see [branch homebrew_gazebo_version](#!/osrf/release-tools/commits/branch/homebrew_gazebo_version)), but I ran into linking problems since we are not installing our jenkins code to `/usr/local`.

I think this bug would be resolved with an unpatched protobuf formula if we change our jenkins script to install to `/usr/local`. This would yield other benefits, such as being able to install qt from a bottle, which would save probably 20 minutes per build.

The homebrew test bot installs to `/usr/local` (see [test-bot.rb](https://github.com/Homebrew/homebrew/blob/master/Library/Homebrew/cmd/test-bot.rb)). I'd like to start doing that on our mac mini.
